Welcome to Craft toolbox’s documentation!¶

Contents: this toolbox is build to analysed ouput from CraFT code. It use some folders organisation in the path which is discribe here in the documentation

CraFT run Toolbox¶

Created on 30 sept. 2015 Toolbox to treat data from one run experiment using CraFT

@author: Thomas Chauve @contact: thomas.chauve@lgge.obs.ujf-grenoble.fr @license: CC-BY-CC

class runcraft.runcraft(run_folder, time_data)[source]¶

The ‘run’ CraFT folder is build as follow : an ‘output’ folder where the output data from CraFT are store in the current folder you should find : *.in, *micro.vtk, *.phase, *.output, *.load

This toolbox need over toolboxs :

Library:numpy
Library:os
Library:vtk
Library:image2d
Library:symetricTensorMap
Library:gammarun
__init__(run_folder, time_data)[source]¶

Build data for one CraFT run using *micro.vtk, *.phase, and data within ‘output’ folder at time time_data

Parameters:
  • run_folder (str) – folder were the CraFT run is
  • time_data (str) – time write one the name file
Returns:

runcraft object
Return type:

runcraft

runcraft structure :

Element:*.grainID : is an ‘image2d’ with one value per grains
Element:*.orientation : is an ‘array’ with 4 column (id,phi1,phi,phi2)
Element:*.strain : is an ‘symetricTensorMap’ for the time time_data
Element:*.stress : is an ‘symetricTensorMap’ for the time time_data
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

elstrain()[source]¶
Returns:elastique strain E:sigma
Return type:symetricTensorMap

Warning

FALSE need to rotate E in the lattice crystal for each grain (27/01/2016)

strain_energy()[source]¶

Strain energy map compute as : w=e_ij*s_ij (Einstein notation)

Returns:w strain energy map
Return type:image2d

Multi CraFT run Toolbox¶

Created on 30 sept. 2015 Toolbox to treat data from multiple run experiment using CraFT

@author: Thomas Chauve @contact: thomas.chauve@lgge.obs.ujf-grenoble.fr @license: CC-BY-CC

class multiruncraft.multiruncraft(adr_folder, time_data, folder_init)[source]¶

This toolbox need over toolboxs :

Library:os
Library:runcraft
__init__(adr_folder, time_data, folder_init)[source]¶

Build the object multiruncraft

Parameters:
  • adr_folder (str) – path to the folder were all the run are present
  • time_data (str) – suffix of one vtk file you want analyse
  • folder_init (str) – folder where is the run of the initial state you want campare with
Returns:

multiruncraft object
Return type:

multiruncraft

symetricTensorMap structure :

Element:*.run : list with n ‘runcraft’ object (n=number of craft run)
Element:*.init : the initial craft run you want compare with

Warning

inside adr_folder the structure should be for each run you find a “runi” folder with inside this a ‘output’ folder were the CraFT output are.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

info(selectGrain=False, ngId=0)[source]¶

Give info about the number of differents orientations tested. What are these orientations ? And what is the GrainId of the new grain. If no option are pass there is two option. 1- If the ngId is equal to the maxId of the init micro + 1, it take it as a new grain. 2- If not, it ask the user which is the ngId.

Parameters:
  • selectGrain (bool) – User select the new grain by clic on the microstructure (default False)
  • ngId (int) – User give the new grainId directly
Returns:

ngId: the new grain Id
Return type:

int
Returns:

tested_ori: The orientation for the new grain tested with CraFT
Return type:

array
plotpdf(option, mask=0, selectGrain=False, ngId=0, norm=False)[source]¶

Plot pole figure data of the option wanted using a mask if necessary By default the new grain ID ngId is the maxId(init data)+1 (see .info)

Parameters:
  • option (str) – a runcraft image2d link (exemple : ‘strain.t22’ or ‘stress.t11’ or ‘strain.eqtensor2d()’ or ‘strain_energie()’)
  • mask (image2d) –
  • selectGrain (bool) – User select the new grain by clic on the microstructure (default False)
  • ngId (int) – User give the new grainId directly
  • norm (bool) – normalized value by mean(strain.t22)
Returns:

maxori is the line of the orientation output from .info function for which the data plot are maximal
Return type:

int
Returns:

minori is the line of the orientation output from .info function for which the data plot are minimum
Return type:

int

Other functions¶

plotpdf_craft.fmt(x, pos)[source]¶

function to format tick in the figure as x*10^y

plotpdf_craft.plotpdf_craft(phi1, phi, color, colorbarcenter=True)[source]¶

Plot on the pole figure at each phi1,phi given, the associated color value.

Parameters:
  • phi1 (array) – phi1 Bunge Euler angle
  • phi (array) – phi Bunge Euler angle
  • color (array) – array of value
  • colorbarcenter (bool) – do you want center the colorbar around 0

Other object defined¶

symetricTensorMap¶

Created on 21 oct. 2015 This class defined map of symetric def positive tensor map.

@author: Thomas Chauve @contact: thomas.chauve@lgge.obs.ujf-grenoble.fr @license: CC-BY-CC

class symetricTensorMap.symetricTensorMap(t11, t22, t33, t12, t13, t23)[source]¶

This class defined map of symetric def positive tensor map.

This toolbox is running on python and need various packages :

Library:image2d
__add__(other)[source]¶

Compute the sum of two map tensor

Returns:symetricTensorMap
Return type:symetricTensorMap
__init__(t11, t22, t33, t12, t13, t23)[source]¶

Build symetricTensorMap object with 6 map (image2d object)

t11 t12 t13
t22 t23
t33
Parameters:tii (image2d) – map of tii composante
Returns:symetricTensorMap object
Return type:symetricTensorMap

symetricTensorMap structure :

Element:*.tii : 6 ‘image2d’
__mul__(other)[source]¶

Compute the multiplication pixel by pixel of two map tensor

Returns:symetricTensorMap
Return type:symetricTensorMap
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

diag(twod=True)[source]¶

Diagonalisation of the symetricTensorMap

Parameters:twod (bool) – use a 2d symetric tensor (=> t33=t23=t13=0) (default True)
Returns:a, eigenvalue dim(3*n*m) where n*m is the dimension of the map (self.t11.field.shape)
Return type:array (3*n*m)
Returns:v, eigenvector dim(3*3*n*m) where n*m is the dimension of the map (self.t11.field.shape)
Return type:array (3*n*m)

Note

the eigenvector v(:,k,n,m) is associated to the eigenvalue a(k,n,m)

eqVonMises()[source]¶

Compute the Von Mises equivalent norm of the tensor

Returns:Von Mises equivalent norm (2/3*eij*eij)^0.5
Return type:image2d
eqtensor2d()[source]¶

Compute the equivalent norm of the tensor as it is a 2D mesurement

teq=sqrt(2/3*(t11^2+t22^2+2*t12^2))

Returns:equivalent norm as it is a 2d measurement
Return type:image2d
principal_tensor(scale=100, space=5, twod=False, absolutemax=False, colorbarcenter=True)[source]¶

Plot the principal tensor direction

Parameters:
  • scale (float) – scale of the arrow (default 100)
  • space (int) – take only 1 value every ‘space’ value to not charge the picture to much (default 5)
  • twod (bool) – use a 2d symetric tensor (=> t33=t23=t13=0) (default False)
  • colorbarcenter (bool) – do you want center the colorbar around 0
Returns:

image of the principal tensor direction
Return type:

matplotlib.pyplot

gammarun¶

Created on 26 jan. 2016 This class is build to use gamma output from CraFT

@author: Thomas Chauve @contact: thomas.chauve@lgge.obs.ujf-grenoble.fr @license: CC-BY-CC

class gammarun.gammarun(g1, g2, g3, g4, g5, g6, g7, g8, g9, g10, g11, g12)[source]¶

This class defined gamma structure for CraFT output.

This toolbox is running on python and need various packages :

Library:numpy
Library:image2d
Library:gammamap

Build gamma object with 12 map (image2d object)

Parameters:gi (image2d) – map of gi
Returns:gamma object
Return type:gamma

gamma structure :

Element:*.gi : 12 ‘image2d’

gammamap¶

Created on 27 jan. 2016 This class is build to build gamma map

@author: Thomas Chauve @contact: thomas.chauve@lgge.obs.ujf-grenoble.fr @license: CC-BY-CC

class gammamap.gammamap(map, burger, plane)[source]¶

This toolbox is building a gamma map

This toolbox is running on python and need various packages :

Library:image2d
__init__(map, burger, plane)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • map (image2d) – output map from CraFT
  • burger (array) – burger vector of the slip system
  • plane (array) – normal vector of the plane of the slip system
Returns:

gammamap object with ‘.map’ (output from CraFT), ‘.b’ burger vector ‘.plane’ planver vector of the slip system
Return type:

gammamap
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

schmidtensor(sTM=False)[source]¶

Compute the schmidtensor 1/2*(b*plane+plane*b)

Parameters:sTM (bool) – if you want the schmid tensor return under a symetric tensor map
Returns:array 3*3
Return type:array or symetricTensorMap
vpstrain()[source]¶
Returns:viscoplastic strain of the slip system
Return type:symetricTensorMap

image2d¶

Created on 3 juil. 2015

image2d is a class used to manipulate image under matrix shape and to do the analyses on the picture

Note

It has been build to manipulate both aita data and dic data

Warning

As all function are applicable to aita and dic data, please be careful of the meaning of what you are doing depending of the input data used !

@author: Thomas Chauve @contact: thomas.chauve@lgge.obs.ujf-grenoble.fr @license: CC-BY-CC

class image2d.image2d(field, resolution)[source]¶

image2d is a class for map of scalar data

__add__(other)[source]¶

Sum of 2 maps

__div__(other)[source]¶

Divide self by other case by case

__init__(field, resolution)[source]¶

Constructor : field is a matrix and resolution is the step size in mm

Parameters:
  • field (array) – tabular of scalar data
  • resolution (float) – step size resolution (millimeters)
__mul__(other)[source]¶

Multiply case by case

__sub__(other)[source]¶

Subtract of 2 maps

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

diff(axis)[source]¶

Derive the image along the axis define

Parameters:axis (str) – ‘x’ to do du/dx or ‘y’ to do du/dy
Returns:differential of the map in respect to the ‘axis’ wanted
Return type:image2d

Warning

‘x’ axis is left to right and ‘y’ is bottom to top direction

grain_label()[source]¶

Label area in a black and white picture

Note

black color for the background and white color for the boundary

imresize(res)[source]¶

Resize the image with nearest interpolation to have a pixel of the length given in res

Parameters:res (float) – new resolution map wanted (millimeters)
mask_build(r=0, grainId=[])[source]¶

Create a mask map with NaN value where you don’t want data and one were you want The default mask is a circle of center you choose and radius you define.

Parameters:
  • r (float) – radius of the circle, If r=0 you clic of each of grain you want
  • grainId – You select the grainId you want in an array
Type:

array
Returns:

mask
Return type:

image2d

Note

if you want applied a mask one your data just do data*mask where data is an image2d object

plot(vmin=nan, vmax=nan, colorbarcenter=False, colorbar=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object at 0x7f83f0155bd0>)[source]¶

plot the image2d

Parameters:
  • vmin (float) – minimum value for the colorbar
  • vmax (float) – maximun value for the colorbar
  • colorbarcenter (bool) – do you want center the colorbar around 0
  • colorbar – colorbar from matplotlib.cm

Note

colorbar : cm.jet for eqstrain-stress

plotBoundary(dilatation=0)[source]¶

Add boundary to the figure

Parameters:

dilatation (int) – number of iteration for the dilation of 1 value - used this to make larger the boundaries (default 2)
Exemple:
>>> data.phi1.plot()
>>> data.micro.plotBoundary(dilatation=10)
>>> plt.show()

Note

plot only the value of the pixel equal at 1

pow(nb)[source]¶

map power nb

Parameters:nb (float) –
skeleton()[source]¶

Skeletonized a label map build by grain_label
